importance: This paper is crucial for researchers in offline black-box optimization.  It introduces **Robust Guided Diffusion (RGD)**, a novel approach that significantly improves the state-of-the-art by combining the strengths of proxy and proxy-free diffusion models.  This work opens new avenues for research by integrating insights from diffusion models into proxy-based methods, leading to more robust and effective optimization strategies. The improved efficiency and robustness of RGD have significant implications for various applications, making it a valuable contribution to the field.
summary: Robust Guided Diffusion (RGD) revolutionizes offline black-box optimization by cleverly combining proxy and proxy-free diffusion for superior conditional generation, achieving state-of-the-art results.
takeaways: RGD combines proxy and proxy-free diffusion for enhanced sampling control and robustness.
Proxy-enhanced sampling and diffusion-based proxy refinement modules improve accuracy and address out-of-distribution issues.
RGD achieves state-of-the-art performance on various design-bench tasks.
tldr:
Offline black-box optimization (BBO) aims to maximize a function using only an existing dataset of designs and their properties.  Current methods, either forward or inverse mappings, struggle with generating high-performance samples beyond the dataset or suffer from robustness issues.  Existing inverse mapping methods such as GANs and proxy-free diffusion have shown promise but lack explicit guidance or robustness.
This paper proposes Robust Guided Diffusion (RGD) to overcome these issues. RGD integrates explicit proxy guidance into proxy-free diffusion using a novel proxy-enhanced sampling module. To enhance robustness, RGD also uses a diffusion-based proxy refinement that seamlessly integrates proxy-free diffusion into the proxy for refinement.  This novel combination allows RGD to reach state-of-the-art results on various BBO benchmark tasks, demonstrating the effectiveness of combining explicit guidance with the robustness of proxy-free diffusion.
